channel.title: Chatbots on Daniel Pritchett
channel.description: Recent content in Chatbots on Daniel Pritchett

item.title: Reading List for Early Career Engineers
item.description: For the past few years I’ve been lucky enough to get to work with #VetsWhoCode, a nonprofit dedicated to training and supporting veterans in transitioning to careers as civilian technologists. Talking with a current mentoring partner has had me suggesting an unreasonable number of interesting books. Each of the books we read help us become better, more capable people but no one’s going to have time to read all the books I’ve read — you’ve got your own life to live!

item.title: Build Chatbot Interactions Available to Order Today!
item.description: I just shipped the first draft of my multi-year book project a few weeks ago and the beta release is available for download now! Check it out and give me a shout ðŸ˜ƒ Build Chatbot Interactions: Responsive, Intuitive Interfaces with Ruby

item.title: Stream Live Coding With Twitch
item.description: Why Livestream? So far Twitch streaming's gotten a good 50 people to check out this book project. Livestreaming seems primarily popular among gamers but there is a growing niche for programming-oriented livestreams. I’m more into programming than gaming at this point in my life, so that’s what I’m streaming. Returning readers will already know about my upcoming book for the Pragmatic Programmers publishing company on chatbots.

item.title: Research Update: Serverless Computing, Kubernetes, Human Interfaces
item.description: I’ve gotten into a lot of research at work and at home. I’ll plant a little signpost here to start the log and then push out little updates as the research progresses. Lambdas and Serverless Functions I wrote more on this for the Clear Function blog at How Can Serverless Functions Help Your Systems? Here are some of the key quotes: Whatâ€™s so great about a serverless function?

item.title: Hearing Aids Are Cool
item.description: Personal story time! I’ve been wearing hearing aids since the 3rd grade. My folks drove me down to Florida State University to get a hearing test and a fitting for some new aids. I lost one of my first pairs in a cardboard box in a cabin in the woods and my parents didn’t even kill me. In the intervening 30 years I’ve been through a few sets of aids. My first few sets were in-the-canal (ITC) aids. My current set is a behind-the-ear (BTE) set.

item.title: Book update: meme generator chapter in progress
item.description: Been a fun Sunday afternoon working on my chat bots book. Here's a sneak preview. I may demo this section at @southeastruby - come say hi! pic.twitter.com/rrZ9aWIg1i — Daniel Pritchett (@DPritchett) August 13, 2017
